Heyy, My name is Bruce and I'm also a Guinness World Record holder.

patterns: Tell us something about you Bruce
how can you help me Bruce
responses: Well, I was discovered, in 1974, north of Thornbill, within the Pembina member of the Pierre Shale formation.
I'm a Tylosaurus Pembinensis and I'm the Guinness World Record holder as the largest publicly displayed mosasaur.
I lived during the late Cretaceous period, approximately 80 million years ago. He swam in a deep sea environment with numerous other marine reptiles.

patterns: Do you have any bird in Aves Class?
responses: Of course, we have a bird in the sub-species of regalis with Genus -- Hesperornis in Hesperornithidae family of the Order of  Hesperornithiformes. It's common name is Hesperornis.

patterns: What kind of fossils do you have?
how many fossils does the museum has?
responses: We have over 10,000 fossils in the Museum which is the Largest collection of Fossils in Canada.
We have over 10,000 fossils listed on the website. Which one are you looking for?

Often the first view of what might be a major find is only a tiny fragment or small bone exposed by the bulldozers working at the mine. For the first step of its removal a large area around the find is excavated to determine the extent of the specimen. This is done with the aid of special tools.For more details you can visit ---    https://discoverfossils.com/research/fossil-preparation
